sen.j: 織田 敏広（おだ としひろ、織田敏廣）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Toshihiro ODA is busho (a Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Toshihiro ODA was busho (a Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 過去形にしました。
sen.e: Toshihiro ODA was busho (a Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 織田郷広の嫡男。
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Satohiro ODA.
He was a legitimate son of Satohiro ODA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Satohiro ODA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尾張国上四郡の守護代。
sen.e: He was shugodai (a deputy military governor) of four upper districts of Owari Province.
He was shugodai (deputy governor) of four upper districts of Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 「守護代」の説明をほかと合わせました。
sen.e: He was shugodai (deputy governor) of four upper districts of Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「伊勢守家」（岩倉織田家）の祖とされる。
sen.e: It is said that he was the founder of "the Oda Isenokami family" (the Iwakura Oda family).
It is said that he was the progenitor of 'the Oda Isenokami family' (the Iwakura Oda family).
sen.cmt: 「祖」の訳を修正しました。原文の「」を' 'に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that he was the progenitor of 'the Oda Isenokami family' (the Iwakura Oda family).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 従兄弟とされる先代織田久広と同一人物とされ、初め久広（ひさひろ）と名乗り、のち尾張国守護・斯波義敏の偏諱を受け、敏広と改めたとされる（異説あり）。
sen.e: It is believed that he and his cousin last Hisahiro ODA were the same person because at first, the former called himself Hisahiro, but later he was granted a portion of the name of Owari no kuni shugo (a provincial constable of Owari Province) Yoshitoshi SHIBA and changed his name into Toshihiro. (There are different opinions.)

It is believed that he was actually the same person as Hisahiro ODA, the man formerly known as Toshihiro's cousin and the previous family head, and that Toshihiro called himself Hisahiro at first, but later changed his name to Toshihiro because he was granted the use of a character of the name of Owari no kuni shugo (governor of Owari Province), Yoshitoshi SHIBA. (There are different opinions.)
sen.cmt: 全体的に整理しました。
sen.e: It is believed that he was actually the same person as Hisahiro ODA, the man formerly known as Toshihiro's cousin and the previous family head, and that Toshihiro called himself Hisahiro at first, but later changed his name to Toshihiro because he was granted the use of a character of the name of Owari no kuni shugo (governor of Owari Province), Yoshitoshi SHIBA (there are different opinions).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: 岩倉城を本拠とした織田敏広の一族「織田伊勢守家」（岩倉織田氏）は元々織田一門の宗家の家柄であった。
sen.e: The Toshihiro's family "the Oda Isenokami family" (the Iwakura Oda clan), whose headquarter was located in Iwakura-jo Castle, was originally the head family of the Oda clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Toshihiro's family, 'the Oda Isenokami family' (the Iwakura Oda clan), residing in Iwakura-jo Castle, was originally the head family of the Oda clan.
sen.cmt: 簡潔化しました。原文の「」を' 'に修正しました。
sen.e: Toshihiro's family, 'the Oda Isenokami family' (the Iwakura Oda clan), residing in Iwakura-jo Castle, was originally the head family of the Oda clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかしやがて、後に清洲城に拠点を置いた分家筋の小守護代「織田大和守家」（清洲織田氏）の織田敏定が次第に勢力を拡大して台頭するようになり、新たな尾張守護として斯波義廉を擁立して争って行く。
sen.e: But because Ko-shugodai (a delegate of delegated guardians) Toshisada ODA from "the Oda Yamato no Kami family"(the Kiyosu ODA clan), a branch family which was later based in Kiyosu-jo Castle, gradually expanded his influence and gained power, Toshihiro put Yoshikado SHIBA forward as new guard of Owari to fight against Toshisada.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, later on, Toshisada ODA from a branch family called 'the Oda Yamatonokami family' (the Kiyosu Oda clan), who was Ko-shugodai (representative of a deputy governor) based in Kiyosu-jo Castle, gradually extended his influence and gained power, and therefore Toshihiro helped Yoshikado SHIBA become new governor of Owari and fought against Toshisada,
sen.cmt: 不適切と思われる表現を変更し、前文とのつながりをよくしました。
sen.e: However, later on, Toshisada ODA from a branch family called 'the Oda Yamatonokami family' (the Kiyosu Oda clan), who was Ko-shugodai (representative of a deputy governor) based in Kiyosu-jo Castle, gradually extended his influence and gained power, and therefore Toshihiro helped Yoshikado SHIBA become new governor of Owari and fought against Toshisada,
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嘉吉元年（1441年）、『建内記』によると父とされる先代郷広が寺社領・本所領を横領して、逐電したため、翌、嘉吉2年（1442年）頃には先代郷広に代わり、久広（敏広か？）が尾張国守護代となったとされる。
sen.e: According to "Kennaiki", because Toshihiro's father last Satohiro embezzled tax money from temples, shrines and honjo (the administrative headquarters of manors) and ran away in 1441, Hisahiro (or Toshihiro) replaced him as Owari no kuni shugodai (a provincial governor of Owari Province) around the next year in 1442.

According to "Kennaiki," since Toshihiro's alleged father, the then deputy governor Satohiro, embezzled tax money from temples, shrines and honjo (manors) and ran away in 1441, Hisahiro (he may have been Toshihiro) replaced him as Owari no kuni shugodai (governor of Owari Province) in the next year (1442) or so.
sen.cmt: 「父とされる」「先代」「本所領」「頃には」「（敏広か？）」の訳や、「守護代」の説明を変更しました。
sen.e: According to "Kennaiki," since Toshihiro's alleged father, the then deputy governor Satohiro, embezzled tax money from temples, shrines and honjo (manors) and ran away in 1441, Hisahiro (he may have been Toshihiro) replaced him as Owari no kuni shugodai (governor of Owari Province) in the next year (1442) or so.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 8代将軍足利義政義政により、郷広が再任を計ろうとした。
sen.e: With help of the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, Satohiro attempted to be restored to his former position.
sen.cmt: 「足利義政義政」を「足利義政」として訳しました。「計ろいとした」は「図ろうとした」として訳しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the help of the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, Satohiro attempted to be restored to his former position.
sen.cmt: helpに冠詞theを付けました。
sen.e: With the help of the eighth Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, Satohiro attempted to be restored to his former position.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、宝徳3年（1451年）頃、主家・斯波氏に命じられ、越前国で郷広を自害に追い込んだ。
sen.e: Therefore in 1451, Toshihiro forced Satohiro to kill himself in Echizen Province by order of his master's house the Shiba clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore in 1451, Toshihiro forced Satohiro to kill himself in Echizen Province by order of his master's family, the Shiba clan.
sen.cmt: 「主家」の訳を文脈に合わせて変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore in 1451, Toshihiro forced Satohiro to kill himself in Echizen Province by order of his master's family, the Shiba clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文正元年（1466年）敏広の娘と婚約していた山名入道（名不評）の要請で、敏広は弟の織田広近とともに上洛。
sen.e: In 1466, Toshihiro and his younger brother Hirochika ODA went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of "Yamana-nyudo" (an unpopular nickname) who was then engaged to the daughter of Toshihiro.
In 1466, Toshihiro and his younger brother Hirochika ODA went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of Yamana-nyudo (lay-monk) (an unpopular nickname), who was engaged to Toshihiro's daughter.
sen.cmt: 原文の「（名不評）」は「（名不詳）」の間違いかと思われます。仕様指示書に従ってそのまま訳出してありますが、「（名不詳）」の場合、正しくは(first name unknown)といった訳になると考えられます。
sen.e: In 1466, Toshihiro and his younger brother Hirochika ODA went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of Yamana-nyudo (lay-monk) (an unpopular nickname), who was engaged to Toshihiro's daughter.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年の応仁元年（1467年）の応仁の乱が起こると、新たな尾張守護として斯波義廉を擁立して、山名持豊率いる西軍側に付く。
sen.e: The following year in 1467 when the Onin War started, Toshihiro put Yoshikado SHIBA forward as new guard of Owari and took the side of the Western Camp led by Mochitoyo YAMANA.
The following year, in 1467 when the Onin War started, Toshihiro backed up Yoshikado SHIBA to make him new governor of Owari and took the side of the Western Camp led by Mochitoyo YAMANA.
sen.cmt: 「擁立して」の部分の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The following year, in 1467 when the Onin War started, Toshihiro backed up Yoshikado SHIBA to make him new governor of Owari and took the side of the Western Camp led by Mochitoyo YAMANA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明 (日本)7年（1475年）11月、京都から主君・義廉を伴って、尾張国へ下国し、尾張国中島郡にある尾張国守護所の下津城に入城した。
sen.e: In November 1475, Toshihiro and his master Yoshikado went down to Owari Province from Kyoto and entered Orizu-jo Castle which housed Owari no kumi shugosho (the provincial administration of Owari Province) in Nakajima County.

In November 1475, Toshihiro accompanied his master Yoshikado from Kyoto to Owari Province, and entered Orizu-jo Castle in Nakajima County, Owari Province, which housed Owari no kuni shugosho (the administration of Owari Province).
sen.cmt: 「伴って」の訳出、kumiをkuniに修正、「尾張国中島郡」の「尾張国」の訳出などを行いました。
sen.e: In November 1475, Toshihiro accompanied his master Yoshikado from Kyoto to Owari Province, and entered Orizu-jo Castle in Nakajima County, Owari Province, which housed Owari no kuni shugosho (the administration of Owari Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年の文明 (日本)8年（1476年）、岳父斎藤妙椿とともに家臣筋「大和守家」（清洲織田氏）の織田敏定と戦った。
sen.e: The next year in 1476, Toshihiro and his father-in-law Myochin SAITO fought against Toshisada ODA from "the Yamato no Kami family" (the Kiyosu ODA clan), a vassal branch family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The next year, in 1476, Toshihiro and his father-in-law Myochin SAITO fought against Toshisada ODA from 'the Yamatonokami family' (the Kiyosu ODA clan), a vassal branch family.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」を' 'に修正しました。
sen.e: The next year, in 1476, Toshihiro and his father-in-law Myochin SAITO fought against Toshisada ODA from 'the Yamatonokami family' (the Kiyosu ODA clan), a vassal branch family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 敏広は敗れて、下津城は落城したため、山田郡の国府宮に逃れた。
sen.e: After Toshihiro was defeated and Orizu-jo Castle fell, he took refuge in the Kokufu Palace in Yamada County.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Toshihiro was defeated and Orizu-jo Castle fell, he took refuge in the Kokufu Palace in Yamada County.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After Toshihiro was defeated and Orizu-jo Castle fell, he took refuge in the Kokufu Palace in Yamada County.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、後に敏広が巻き返して、敏定を尾張から一時的に追放する。
sen.e: But later, he resumed offensive and banished Toshisada and others from Owari for a while.
But later, he resumed offensive and banished Toshisada from Owari for a while.
sen.cmt: and othersを削除しました（banished Toshisada's armyなどでもいいかと思いますが、直訳でもその意味が伝わるかと思います）。
sen.e: But later, he resumed offensive and banished Toshisada from Owari for a while.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明 (日本)10年（1478年）、敏定が幕府から新たに尾張守護代を任じられ、斯波義廉とともに織田氏嫡流であった織田敏広は兇徒とされた。
sen.e: In 1478, Toshisada was newly appointed Owari no kuni shugodai by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and Toshihiro who was a direct descendant of the Oda clan was treated as a rioter along with Yoshikado SHIBA.

In 1478, Toshisada was newly appointed Owari no kuni shugodai by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and Toshihiro, who was a direct descendant of the Oda clan, was treated as a rioter along with Yoshikado SHIBA.
sen.cmt: whoを非制限用法にしました。
sen.e: In 1478, Toshisada was newly appointed Owari no kuni shugodai by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and Toshihiro, who was a direct descendant of the Oda clan, was treated as a rioter along with Yoshikado SHIBA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして同年の10月12日 (旧暦)、尾張に下向した敏定に尾張国春日井郡にある新たな守護所である居城清洲城を奪取された。
sen.e: On October 12 of the same year, Toshisada went down to Owari Province and seized Kiyosu-jo Castle owned by Toshihiro which housed new shugosho in Kasugai County.
On October 12 of the same year, Toshisada went down to Owari and seized Kiyosu-jo Castle owned by Toshihiro, which housed new shugosho in Kasugai County, Owari Province.
sen.cmt: whichを非制限用法にしました。「尾張国」を訳出しました。
sen.e: On October 12 of the same year, Toshisada went down to Owari and seized Kiyosu-jo Castle owned by Toshihiro, which housed new shugosho in Kasugai County, Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年の12月 (旧暦)、妙椿の後ろ盾を得て、敏広は清洲城奪還に乗り出し、敏定と戦って清洲城を囲んだ。
sen.e: In December of the same year, with the backing of Myochin, Toshihiro fought against Toshisada and surrounded Kiyosu-jo Castle to recapture the castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In December of the same year, with the backing of Myochin, Toshihiro fought against Toshisada and surrounded Kiyosu-jo Castle to recapture the castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In December of the same year, with the backing of Myochin, Toshihiro fought against Toshisada and surrounded Kiyosu-jo Castle to recapture the castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 再三の幕府の介入で、清洲城を断念して織田敏定と和睦し、尾張国は「織田大和守家」と「織田伊勢守家」の両織田氏による共同統治となった。
sen.e: In consequence of repeated interventions by the bakufu, Toshihiro gave up the castle and made peace with Toshisada, and so Owari Province was governed by both the Oda Yamato no Kami family and the Oda Isenokami family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the bakufu repeatedly interfered, Toshihiro gave up Kiyosu-jo Castle and made peace with Toshisada ODA, and then it was decided that the Oda Yamatonokami family and the Oda Isenokami family governed Owari Province together.
sen.cmt: 「幕府の介入で」と「共同統治になった」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: After the bakufu repeatedly interfered, Toshihiro gave up Kiyosu-jo Castle and made peace with Toshisada ODA, and then it was decided that the Oda Yamatonokami family and the Oda Isenokami family governed Owari Province together.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尾張上四郡（春日井郡、丹羽郡、葉栗郡、中島郡のこと、最初「伊勢守家」は葉栗郡・丹羽郡と山田郡（のち春日井郡、中島郡へ分割編入）の大半と春日井郡・海西郡と那古野を除く愛知郡 (愛知県)）の守護代となる。
sen.e: Toshihiro became shugodai of four upper districts of Owari (Kasugai County, Niwa County, Haguri County and Nakajima County). (At first, "the Oda Isenokami family" governed Haguri County, Niwa County, much of Yamada County [later divided and integrated into Kasugai and Nakajima Counties], Kasugai County, Kaisai County and Aichi County [Aichi Prefecture] except Nagoya.)

Toshihiro became shugodai of four upper districts of Owari (Kasugai County, Niwa County, Haguri County and Nakajima County). (At first, 'the Oda Isenokami family' governed Haguri County, Niwa County, much of Yamada County [later divided and integrated into Kasugai and Nakajima Counties], Kasugai County, Kaisai County and Aichi County [Aichi Prefecture] except Nagoya.)
sen.cmt: 原文の「」を' 'に修正しました。
sen.e: Toshihiro became shugodai of four upper districts of Owari (namely Kasugai County, Niwa County, Haguri County and Nakajima County. At first, 'the Oda Isenokami family' governed Haguri County, Niwa County, much of Yamada County [later divided and integrated into Kasugai and Nakajima Counties], Kasugai County, Kaisai County and Aichi County [Aichi Prefecture] except Nagoya).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置などを修正しました。

sen.j: 翌年の文明 (日本)11年（1479年）、尾張国丹羽郡に岩倉城 (尾張国)を築城し、岩倉城を居城とした。
sen.e: The following year in 1479, Toshihiro constructed Iwakura-jo Castle in Niwa County, Owari Province and usually lived there.
The following year, in 1479, Toshihiro constructed Iwakura-jo Castle in Niwa County, Owari Province, as his residence.
sen.cmt: 「居城とした」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The following year, in 1479, Toshihiro constructed Iwakura-jo Castle in Niwa County, Owari Province, as his residence.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 2年後の文明 (日本)13年（1481年）3月 (旧暦)、「大和守家」との和睦が崩れ、敏定と戦って敗れた。
sen.e: Two years later in March 1481, following the breakdown of peace between the Oda Isenokami family and the Oda Yamato no Kami family, he fought against Toshisada but suffered a defeat.
Two years later, in March 1481, following the breakdown of peace between the Oda Isenokami family and the Oda Yamatonokami family, he fought against Toshisada but suffered a defeat.
sen.cmt: 「大和守家」の表記などをほかと統一しました。
sen.e: Two years later, in March 1481, following the breakdown of peace between the Oda Isenokami family and the Oda Yamatonokami family, he fought against Toshisada but suffered a defeat.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: のち病死。（3月以前に戦死とも）。
sen.e: Later he died of a disease. (He is also said to have died in battle before March 1481.)
Later he died of a disease. (He is also said to have died in battle before March 1481.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Later he died of a disease (he is also said to have died in battle before March 1481).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: 家督は弟広近の子で養子の千代夜叉丸（織田寛広）が継いで、岩倉織田氏として続いた。
sen.e: Chiyo-yashamaru (Tohiro ODA), the adopted son of Toshihiro's brother Hirochika, took over the reigns of the Iwakura Oda clan.
After his death, Chiyo-yashamaru (Tohiro ODA), the adopted son of Toshihiro's brother Hirochika, succeeded him as head of the clan, which continued as the Iwakura Oda clan.
sen.cmt: 「継いで」の訳を変更し、「続いた」を訳出しました。このファイルの５番目の原文では「岩倉織田家」とありますので、それに合わせますと、ここの訳は、head of the family、the Iwakura Oda familyとなると思います。
sen.e: After his death, Chiyo-yashamaru (Tohiro ODA), the adopted son of Toshihiro's brother Hirochika, succeeded him as head of the clan, which continued as the Iwakura Oda clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
